article.headline: Montana 79, Portland State 65
article.story: MISSOULA, Mont. (AP) -- Kevin Criswell scored 24 points and Kamarr Davis added 21 Saturday night as Montana defeated Big Sky Conference champion Portland State 79-65. The victory guarantees Montana (14-12, 8-5 Big Sky) a March 5 home game in the first round of the conference tournament. Portland State (19-8, 11-3) wrapped up the top seed with an overtime victory at Montana State Thursday and will play host to the semifinal and championship games March 8-9. The Grizzlies scored 10 unanswered points midway through the second half to take a 55-42 lead with 9:53 remaining. Matt Dlouhy, who scored 18 points, and Corey Easley, who added 10, both had dunks during the run. Portland State never got closer to nine points after that, the last time at 67-58 on a 3-pointer by Jake Schroeder with 4:09 left. Criswell answered with a 3-pointer of his own 16 seconds later. Criswell hit 12-of-16 free throws for half his points, and the Grizzlies were 29-of-41 at the foul line. Portland State was called for 26 fouls, had two players foul out and made just 10-of-17 free throw attempts. Seamus Boxley hit 10 of his 15 field goal attempts and led Portland State with 22 points, but played only 20 minutes because he got into foul trouble as well. Schroeder was 4-of-6 on 3-pointers and had 14 points. Will Funn had 10 assists for PSU. The Grizzlies, who turned the ball over 26 times in an 89-77 loss to the Vikings earlier this season, had just seven turnovers against Portland State's press this time. The Vikings had 18 turnovers. Montana led 36-32 at halftime.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
